issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:

comments.body:
Hi All,

looking at the code and steve's stack trace, I noticed that the 'doDescribeSensors()' operation doesn't do the normal 'initialize()' stuff at the beginning like all other CC operation routines.  I'm not positive, but it may be that a CC process that is hit first with doDescribeSensors() might fail because it hasn't run through any initialize stuff (setting up shared buffers, etc).  Is there an explicit reason for not calling the initlization routines in that op? (generally, all ops have the init stuff since we don't know which op will be called first on a freshly started CC).

No, there is no explicit reason. Thanks for noticing this, Dan. I added the initialization invocation and am running the change, along with several other fixes, through QA now. Will commit to 'testing' on Saturday if all goes well. I will then initiate another long-term-ish test to see if that solves the problem.
